author: anmenaga
body:
This is related to #1903 (Release .deb packages for Debian 8 "jessie").

With this change, package name for Ubuntu14 package will be changed:
from:
powershell_6.0.0-alpha.18-1ubuntu1.14.04.1_amd64.deb
to:
powershell_6.0.0-alpha.18-1ubuntu1.14.04.1-debian8_amd64.deb

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: The change LGTM, but I want @joeyaiello to ack on the filename

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: Per the FrankenDebian post and [this](https://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/debian-faq/ch-pkg_basics.en.html), I think we should have a separate package that follows the guidelines of 7.3

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @joeyaiello per @anmenaga the current Ubuntu14.04 pkg conforms unless you can point out something specific.  assuming it is kosher, it doesn't make sense to me to have the exact same deb with different names.  are we ok to ship beta1 with the current pkg naming and resolve this in our next beta?

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
If there's no change to the package, there's no value in renaming the filename. In fact, unless it's 100% following the Debian guidelines, it's potentially inaccurate.

If it is in fact 100% compliant, I think the only thing that would really provide value to Debian users would be to add a renamed package to the Debian 8 repo on packages.microsoft.com. 

For more context, the priority here is to make sure that we're compliant with Debians guidelines to the letter of the law that would allow it to be pulled into an official Debian repo in the future. 

If that's not possible today, I'd instead recommend updating the install instructions to point Debian 8 at the Ubuntu package with a reference to the FrankenDebian guidance 

Does that sound reasonable?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I read through the Debian guidelines and thought `<foo>_<VersionNumber>-<DebianRevisionNumber>_<DebianArchitecture>.deb` meant that we should include the supported Debian version for `<DebianRevisionNumber>`, but looking at the official Debian package repository for Deb8, it doesn't appear to be the case.  They are just named `<foo>_<VersionNumber>_<Arch>.deb`.  So I think we are fine with just the current name and can close this PR.

title: Rename Ubuntu14 package to include Debian8
